articles.contents:
Home
          
          
          
          
          
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Arnaud Natal
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        CV
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Research
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            
            Welcome to my page!
            I am a temporary lecturer and research assistant at the
            Economics
            department of the University of Bordeaux in France and
            affiliated with the French Institute of
            Pondicherry in India.
            I obtained my PhD in economics from the University of
            Bordeaux in December 2023. My main field of interest is
            development economics, and I work on topics related to
            household indebtedness, labour, and cognition in rural South
            India. My PhD dissertation is freely available on HAL.
            I take part in the activities of the Observatory of Rural
            Dynamics and Inequalities in South India, in particular
            by actively participating in all stages of the collection of
            longitudinal NEEMSIS household
            data.
            Networks: Google
            Scholar | ORCID |
            Research
            Gate | GitHub | Repec | IdHAL | Linkedin
            Contact:  BSE UMR-CNRS 6060, 
            Université de Bordeaux,  16 Avenue Léon Duguit, 
            33608 PESSAC CEDEX, FRANCE. arnaud.natal@u-bordeaux.fr

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
Contents
Publications in
peer-reviewed journals
Working
papers
In progress
Policy
briefs
Technical
reports
Data

My research agenda is centred around economic questions related to
rural dynamics in developing countries, particularly financial
behaviour, labour and cognition of households in rural South India. The
methods I use are determined by the research questions that arise but
revolve around rigorous statistical analysis (e.g., econometrics,
machine learning). I attach great importance to the quality of the data
used, and in the interests of transparency and respect for ethical
principles, all the R and Stata scripts developed to conduct the
statistical and econometric analyses of my research work are freely
accessible here.
Publications in
peer-reviewed journals
Surviving Debt, Survival Debt in Times of Lockdown. Economic
& Political Weekly, 57(1), 41–49, with I. Guérin, S. Michiels,
C.J. Nordman, & G. Venkatasubramanian, G. (2022). Full article
available here.
Locus of Control, Social Identity, and Indebtedness in South India.
Revue d’Économie du Développement, 31(2-3), 95-101, with C.J.
Nordman. (2022). DOI: 10.3917/edd.362.0095
Working papers
Ten years of labour, migration and debt in India: Insights from
original longitudinal household surveys in Tamil Nadu, with M. Di
Santolo, I. Guérin, S. Michiels, C. Mouchel, C.J. Nordman & G.
Venkatasubramanian.
In progress
The Political and Sexual Economies of Marriages: Two Decades of
change in South-Arcot, South India, with I. Guérin, C.J. Nordman
& G. Venkatasubramanian.
Individual Debt Traps: Insights from Rural Tamil Nadu.
Hard Times: Measure and Analysis of Household’s Financial
Vulnerability in Rural South India.
She Works Hard for the Money: Financial Vulnerability and Labour
Supply in Rural South India.
A Change is Gonna Come: Measures and Stability of Personality
Traits in Rural South India, with C.J. Nordman.
Psychology of Debt in Rural South India, with C.J.
Nordman.
Policy briefs
Why and how to measure household debt in informal
economies?, ODRIIS Policy brief No. 1, with I. Guérin & G.
Venkatasubramanian. (2024). IRD, IFP, and ODRIIS.
Technical reports
RUME (2010) Survey Manual, Tech. rep. No. hal-04153130, with I.
Guérin, G. Venkatasubramanian, S. Michiels, & M. Roesch. (2023).
IRD, IFP, and ODRIIS.
How to handle personality traits and cognitive skills variables
in the NEEMSIS-1 (2016-17) survey wave?, NEEMSIS
technical note No. 2, with A. Hilger. (2023). IRD, IFP, and
ODRIIS.
RUME-NEEMSIS survey: How to Handle Panel Data?, NEEMSIS
technical note No. 1. (2023). IRD, IFP, and ODRIIS.
NEEMSIS-2 Survey Manual, Tech. rep. No. hal-04207258, with C. J.
Nordman, G. Venkatasubramanian, I. Guérin, S. Michiels, C. Mouchel,
& M. Di Santolo. (2021). IRD, IFP, and ODRIIS.
Data
NEEMSIS-1 wave data, with C. J. Nordman, I. Guérin, G.
Venkatasubramanian, S. Michiels, Y. Lanos, A. Hilger, S. Kumar, & A.
Raj. (2023). Harvard Dataverse. DOI: 10.7910/DVN/KN3KFJ
RUME survey data, with I. Guérin, G. Venkatasubramanian, S.
Michiels, & M. Roesch. (2023). Harvard Dataverse. DOI: 10.7910/DVN/2KVFXG
